text: the Student Association is hosting an
event called ask and EC which is
basically an opportunity for the RC's to
come and ask any questions they have
whether it's you know what binder should
I be using or deep life advice one of
the questions that I got from a lot of
tired looking RC's was you know how much
sleep do you actually get and I told
them that maybe the first couple of
weeks really not that much how do I
integrate my partner and what I told
them basically was you know get them
involved early and often they're going
to be plenty of section outings at the
beginning well one of my favorites was
someone asked me you know what do I do
at the end of the semester if I don't
have an internship offer I thought it
was a great question mainly because
nobody has an internship offer at the
end of this semester uh so I and I
didn't even have my internship offer
until after classes were out so I think
that kind of eased up her expectations
what are the chances that I'm going to
get to go to the field 2 country that I
want to go to the answer is most of my
friends get to go to their top three
countries even people who went to
countries that weren't their Top Choice
uh sometimes even had a better
experience because of their project or
because of their team there's this whole
pitch that HBS makes about the network
and your biggest question is how do I
take advantage of it um and so for me I
I I gave her two pieces of advice I
think the first one is around the
section experience and if you're able to
like really create a strong bond with
your section they can become like your
family I think the second thing is that
in order to really find your place at
HBS it's important to figure out how
you're going to give back back to the
community you know because as soon as
you figure out how am I going to thrive
in this community how am I going to
contribute to it uh you start finding
like-minded people people who share your
values people who kind of want to
participate in the same activities and
that's like when you really are able to
find your place so when RC asked me he
was kind of overwhelmed with everything
he's like a lot of things are hitting
him at once and he was he was nervous
that he's kind of behind everybody else
so he just asked any tips on you know
how to get comfortable here and I talk
said the first thing he's not behind
people can hide they kind of fear well
here but everyone has no idea what's
going on and so I told him to take
comfort in that everyone is in the same
position that you are so that you guys
can just lean on each other for support
because there's no one that really knows
anything more than you do so you all
figure it out together
